newsitem.title: USA: BEFORE THE BELL - Oracle rallies, IBM up.
newsitem.headline: BEFORE THE BELL - Oracle rallies, IBM up.

text.p: Shares in Oracle Corp rose preceding Friday's U.S. market open after the company reported fiscal first quarter results in line with expectations after yesterday's market close.
Soon after the earnings were announced, the stock slid in after-hours trade, then rose to 1/2 to 38.
But the buying carried through to this morning, sending the stock up 2-1/4 to 39-3/4, according to Instinet.
Oracle reported net income of $0.17 per share compared to $0.08 per share, including a charge. The First Call consensus estimate for the quarter was $0.17 per share.
"It looks like some people were fearing a bad number from Oracle, but it was in-line," a trader said.
"Everything is going up, the market is going higher," he added, referring to a rush of early buy orders spurred by two key economic reports that soothed the market's inflation fear.
Specifically, the August consumer price index and retail sales data were below expectations.
Trader said International Business Machines added 3/8 to 117-5/8, an early beneficiary of the positive mood.
Doubletree Corp said last night it will acquire Red Lion Hotels in a stock, cash and debt assumption deal worth $1.2 billion.
Terms of the transaction value Red Lion at $30.11 per share -- $21.30 in cash and $8.81 in Doubletree common stock.
Early Friday, Red Lion traded unchanged from its 28-3/4 New York Stock Exchange close yesterday, while Doubletree Corp made no moves on the Nasdaq market.
